result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Detavius D Ollie

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Detavius D Ollie not in court.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a calendar call.  Defense is in trial on another matter and does not appear in court.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Detavius D Ollie not in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Detavius D Ollie.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court orders defendant to appear in person at the next court date. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Calendar call scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Detavius D Ollie in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer D. Schleis. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 608 Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Detavius D Ollie in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BOTH APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Bench warrant was issued 6/17/2022, defendant failed to appear due to the wrong date being given to him at his initial appearance.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Detavius D Ollie not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Detavius D Ollie in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/03/2022@1p
